sentence.Network_en: He struggled to hold the bike down on the banked corners.
sentence.Network_cn: 拐过斜弯时他竭力将自行车把稳。

sentence.Network_en: Young people came from the four corners of the nation.
sentence.Network_cn: 全国各地的年轻人都来到这里。

sentence.Network_en: Salter held the bag by the corners and shook it upside down.
sentence.Network_cn: 索尔特捏住包的外角，把它倒过来晃了晃。

entry.def: A corner is a point or an area where two or more edges, sides, or surfaces of something join.

example.ex: He saw the corner of a magazine sticking out from under the blanket...
example.tran: 他看见杂志的一角从毯子下露了出来。

example.ex: Write 'By Airmail' in the top left hand corner.
example.tran: 在左上角写上“航空邮递”。

entry.def: The corner of a room, box, or similar space is the area inside it where its edges or walls meet.

example.ex: ...a card table in the corner of the living room...
example.tran: 起居室角落里的牌桌

example.ex: The ball hurtled into the far corner of the net...
example.tran: 球飞进了球网的远角。

entry.def: The corner of your mouth or eye is the side of it.

example.ex: She flicked a crumb off the corner of her mouth...
example.tran: 她擦掉嘴角的面包屑。

example.ex: Out of the corner of her eye she saw that a car had stopped.
example.tran: 她用眼角的余光瞥见一辆车停了下来。

entry.def: The corner of a street is the place where one of its sides ends as it joins another street.

example.ex: She would spend the day hanging round street corners...
example.tran: 她会整天在街角附近游荡。

example.ex: We can't have police officers on every corner...
example.tran: 不可能每个街角都派驻警察。

entry.def: A corner is a bend in a road.

example.ex: ...a sharp corner...
example.tran: 急转弯

example.ex: The road is a succession of hairpin bends, hills, and blind corners.
example.tran: 这条路上急转弯、坡道和死拐角一个接一个。

entry.tran: (遥远或难以到达的)角落，偏远处
entry.def: If you talk about the corners of the world, a country, or some other place, you are referring to places that are far away or difficult to get to.

example.ex: Buyers came from all corners of the world...
example.tran: 买主来自世界各地。

example.ex: The group has been living in a remote corner of the Cambodian jungle.
example.tran: 该部落一直居住在柬埔寨的丛林深处。

entry.def: In football, hockey, and some other sports, a corner is a free shot or kick taken from the corner of the pitch.

entry.tran: 将…逼入死角；使走投无路
entry.def: If you corner a person or animal, you force them into a place they cannot escape from.

example.ex: A police motorcycle chased his car twelve miles, and cornered him near Rome...
example.tran: 一辆摩托警车跟在他的车后追了12英里，最后在快到罗马时将他截住。

example.ex: He was still sitting huddled like a cornered animal.
example.tran: 他还像一头困兽一样蜷缩着坐在那儿。

entry.def: If you corner someone, you force them to speak to you when they have been trying to avoid you.

example.ex: Golan managed to corner the young producer-director for an interview.
example.tran: 戈兰设法截住了那位兼任制片人的年轻导演，对其进行了采访。

entry.def: If a company or place corners an area of trade, they gain control over it so that no one else can have any success in that area.

example.ex: This restaurant has cornered the Madrid market for specialist paellas...
example.tran: 这家餐馆垄断了马德里的特色肉菜饭市场。

example.ex: Zurich's affluence came initially from cornering a sizeable chunk of the 14th Century silk trade.
example.tran: 苏黎世的富足最初来自于14世纪对丝绸贸易的高度垄断。

entry.def: If a car, or the person driving it, corners in a particular way, the car goes round bends in roads in this way.

example.ex: Peter drove jerkily, cornering too fast and fumbling the gears.
example.tran: 彼得转弯太急，换挡不利索，车开得一颠一颠的。

entry.def: If you say that something is around the corner, you mean that it will happen very soon. In British English, you can also say that something is round the corner .

example.ex: The Chancellor of the Exchequer says that economic recovery is just around the corner.
example.tran: 财政大臣说经济即将复苏。

entry.def: If you say that something is around the corner, you mean that it is very near. In British English, you can also say that something is round the corner .

example.ex: My new place is just around the corner.
example.tran: 我的新家就在附近。

entry.def: If you cut corners, you do something quickly by doing it in a less thorough way than you should.

example.ex: Take your time, don't cut corners and follow instructions to the letter.
example.tran: 慢慢来，不要图省事，要严格按照说明去做。

entry.tran: 天涯海角;世界各个角落
entry.def: You can use expressions such as the four corners of the world to refer to places that are a long way from each other.

example.ex: They've combed the four corners of the world for the best accessories...
example.tran: 为了找到最好的配件，他们寻遍了每个地方。

example.ex: Young people came from the four corners of the nation.
example.tran: 全国各地的年轻人都来到这里。

entry.def: If you are in a corner or in a tight corner, you are in a situation which is difficult to deal with and get out of.

example.ex: The government is in a corner on interest rates...
example.tran: 政府在利率问题上陷入了困境。

example.ex: He appears to have backed himself into a tight corner.
example.tran: 他似乎已把自己逼入了困境。

list.explanation: 走捷径做事，用简便办法或省力方法做事(为节省时间或金钱)

example.en: They're always finding ways to cut corners.
example.zh: 他们总是找办法走捷径。

example.en: I won't cut corners just to save money. I put quality first.
example.zh: 我不愿意为了省钱而简单从事。我把质量放在首位。

auth_sentence.content: It was that pressure that made people cut corners.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was that pressure that made people cut corners.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was that pressure that made people cut corners.

auth_sentence.content: Riots of colour sit alongside quiet, reflective corners.
auth_sentence.res_content: Riots of colour sit alongside quiet, reflective corners.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Riots of colour sit alongside quiet, reflective corners.

auth_sentence.content: The result is that serious corners have been cut.
auth_sentence.res_content: The result is that serious corners have been cut.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The result is that serious corners have been cut.

Sentence.sentence: This reminds me unpleasantly of Sunnyhill School in Streatham, with its harsh tarmac, where I used to hang about in corners fantasising about wildlife.
